thread.title: Samantha Armytage on smokers: Breakfast host slams people who throw their butts out of the car | NT News
thread.title_full: Samantha Armytage on smokers: Breakfast host slams people who throw their butts out of the car | NT News

title: Samantha Armytage on smokers: Breakfast host slams people who throw their butts out of the car | NT News
text:
Sunrise host Sam Armytage isn’t too happy with smokers saying they’re to blame for fires news.com.au February 5, 2017 12:05pm 
LAST month she was fighting granny panty headlines and slamming fake dating rumours, this month she has a new target in her sights. 
Smokers that litter. 
The breakfast host was outraged after she found out a fire that came dangerously close to properties in the Riverina area of New South Wales was started by a cigarette butt. 
Armytage’s father is a volunteer fireman in the same area and was part of the team attempting to extinguish the blaze. 
In an Instagram post, the popular Sunrise host took aim at smokers who throw their butts out the window. A photo posted by Samantha Armytage (@sam_armytage) on Feb 3, 2017 at 3:30pm PST 
Armytage encouraged the potential tossers to “think about it” and cleared up any confusion that the post might not be coming from the host herself. 
“Written, spoken & authorised by Samantha Armytage,” she wrote. 
Her father Mac Armytage has been a Rural Fire Service volunteer for 43 years and has previously received a medal for his service. 
The Daily Advertiser reported the fire burnt through more than ten acres of state forest and came close to property loss. 
40-year old Armytage, who grew up on a sheep property in the Snowy Mountains, has always been proud of her country heritage. 
Her newest Instagram post is just another example of the Sunrise host’s compassion for taking care of the country.
